definition:
1. To rove over, through, or about in a stealthy manner; esp., to search in, as for prey or booty. He prowls each place, still in new colors decked. Sir P. Sidney. 2. To collect by plunder; as, to prowl money. [Obs.]

To rove or wander stealthily, esp. for prey, as a wild beast; hence, to prey; to plunder.

The act of prowling. [Colloq.] Smart.
